text:
If apr-util supports Win9x family, this is a show stopper bug.

Please refer to the following URL,
http://bugs.activestate.com/old.ActivePerl/core?id=1302
creator: inoue@ariel-networks.com

text:
Win 9x demonstrates the bug, but brainstorming here, we believe that it could
also depend upon the filesystem, meaning that other platforms might not make
the zero-fill assumption.

So perhaps this should become an autoconf detected feature, and implement for
Win9x.  But notice you patch doesn't test for Win9x, you tested the compile time
Win32 which is also true of WinNT, and that's not acceptable.

Will consider a more appropriate patch testing oslevel at runtime.
creator: wrowe@apache.org
wrowe@apache.org
text:
Testing the oslevel doesn't quite work, since apr-util is supposed to be platform
agnostic.  I have a better thought; when seeking past the EOF, zero fill the
file if that's the expected behavior except for these broken platforms.

I presume these include Win95, Win98, and WinME.

Comments?
Mass reassign the 44 open apr-bugs to apr bug list
creator: wrowe@apache.org
wrowe@apache.org
text:
MS has completely terminated all manners of support for 95/98/ME, let's kill
this issue as an OS flaw and leave it at that.  If someone has the urge to
write a test to show it up, that would be fine, but no code change really
worthwhile here.
